attributes.action: All gyms across the UK to accept children under 18
attributes.additional_details: If a child is using the gym correctly there is no reason why they can't be allowed to own a gym membership. The gym can also boost a child's confidence massively and benfit them in later life.
attributes.background: Some gyms across the UK do not accept children under the age of 18 and as children are growing and developing muscles they want to improve their fitness and strength.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether to offer services to people under the age of 18 are a matter for individual businesses, not the UK Government or Parliament.
